title: I love how Riot can't stop bots
body:
Especially when they use such blatant naming conventions

"Name V2 Name" is the current set.

And they ALL do this sort of shit.

replies.body:
Hey man!

I'll be honest here and say that the bot detection system isn't up to standard ATM, there are too many bots in **Co-op vs. AI** and **ARAM** matches. 

Let me be clear, this doesn't mean nothing is being done. Bot accounts are being banned as we speak, but it's clearly not happening quickly and efficiently enough.

 Please understand though, that a lot of the team at **Riot** is busy with the Dynamic Queue debacle and getting the Tribunal in shape. This might mean that we'll have to sit tight for a while on this issue.
  
> If you're looking to help, **Riot** would greatly appreciate if you could report every bot under cheating in the end game screen. If you're willing to go the extra mile, you can also send in any summoner names to [Riot Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).
>  
> When something isn't right we shouldn't feel helpless. The community has far more power than we think. _If we all did our part to fix the issues we care about, this game would be a better place._

Thanks for letting us know :)

Hey Tele, 8 months later, same naming convention, they are up to IH in terms of it and are using the same botting script.

Still think riot give a shit?
Bad results doesn't imply not caring. If you want to actually have a discussion, you've really got to look at the issue objectively.

OK objectively riot sucks at doing anything to combat bots outside of relying on possibly new players to actually identify them.

Legit still using the same naming convention, probably the same exact bot, and still you can't do shit.

I hope our discussion through the client chat helped explain my stance on that :D

But essentially, I do believe the system is working to some extent. But some bots are missed, and the fact that they are banned in waves makes the community notice them more.

We definitely agree that more can, and needs to be done.

Why don't they just hire 1 person, wouldn't cost that much. One person with greater powers to view games, like they could see a list of all games currently in progress on the server. Would be then very easy to nuke bots, trolls and feeders. Incoming reports could also be on display for this person, so they could quickly "grab a copy" and follow said players to see if its insta-bannable. This person would also have analytical tools to scan computers lol folder for scripts or hacks.

Hire someone with a brain, who can put two and two together.

I'll just expand on what **Heartvine** said here. 

+ People underestimate the amount of bots, because they go based off their experience in-game. But there's actually a lot of bots who drop to such a low skill level that they end up mainly playing with just other bots. 

 And usually those games with only bots go completely unnoticed, unless a low elo player is unlucky enough to get matched into one of those games with 9 other bots.


+ Another thing to consider is that bots aren't so easy to actually detect. Some are really obvious, but I've also seen many bots consistently going 2/15/31 in ARAM. 

 Scores isn't enough in many cases. You have to start looking at their playstyle, chat logs etc. And it gets very time consuming quite quickly.

 You also have to be extremely careful that the person you're perma-banning is an actual bot. Getting it wrong means an innocent player looses their account.

___*

But I'm always of the thought that, simply claiming other ideas won't be effective, while having no ideas of your own is pointless.

So here's my idea that I believe would end 50% of bots for good.

**Captchas.**

 
Here's how it would work:

+ If a player is reported quite a few times for "being a bot", then they get given captchas to fill out after each game for 10 games. 

I sounds simple, but it now just got way harder for botters. They can't just leave their scripts on 24/7 anymore. Not even the most advanced bots can get through capchas, that's why they're used everywhere. Now the botter is forced has to fill out captchas all the time, or stop running his bots.

The only negative is that a real player might get 10 capcha penalty accidentally. But unlike a ban, for humans a capcha after a game is a just minor inconvenience. 

Feel free to critique my idea too BTW :D

I like the Captcha idea. But Riot staff should have some sort of access to every game currently in progress. Like a server connection that shows the games in progress (with summoner names displayed). That way you could easily monitor "name V2 name" for example. 

"Another thing to consider is that bots aren't so easy to actually detect." I disagree with this. You don't ban on the spot, you do a proper investigation. For example a staff member should have access to ALL functions in a game, so you can see the chat the movements and where they are mouse clicking. If you spot something suspicious you monitor it. Slap the captcha on it. And see what happens. It's time consuming but that's what a job is. Obvious cases are not so time consuming. For example usually a botter runs more than one bot concurrently. Plus the botter is usually online at the same time. Do an ip check on multiple accounts online at the same time. A DMAC check. A virtual machines check. Putting a ban on the root cause would work rather nicely. On a server like OCE with such a low population, I would say that you could eliminate 99% of threats rather easily.

Just to let you know, I have been a cheat buster on worldwide chess servers (7000000 accounts) in the past. There are many techniques involved. With cheaters there's always something leading back to them that you can use.

TBH, if Riot was going to develop a system like that, I'd love to rather see it made as part of the tribunal. So you give the players the ability to review games and vote on punishment. Really similar to CS:GO's [Overwatch](http://blog.counter-strike.net/index.php/overwatch/) system actually.

But that's a bit of a pipe dream I think :D

that said, you'd have to refine it to the same machine and then you'd have to be able to distinguish between virtual machines. Since simply, the same service, could be from things like internet cafes and people who might be playing a sneaky aram during their 9am Law for Healthcare professionals lecture on the university wifi.

Not as easy as you might think.

At any given moment there can be thousands, tens of thousands or even hundreds of thousands of games being played *on a single server* (not so much for the smaller ones, but the point still stands). In order for Riot to properly implement such an idea they would likely need to hire hundreds, if not thousands, of people.

The possibility brought up by YellowBrickRoad would be far more effective, and a lot less costly.

his solution could also be improved if you used certain thresholds for values taken from games through a similar way as things like how grades are calculated, such as distance travelled, lane movements (i.e. spotting the pattern of 'run it down mid'), damage dealt, cs, tower damage taken, k:d:a, and use of summoner spells.

It might be a little tricky but it's completely doable and then you could issue warnings to players who have multiple flagged games in a row and if they continue you could issue a soft ban wherein the player must contact player support to unban the account.

Maybe RIOT should hire you then, to scroll through every single one of the millions and millions of summoner names and flag each one with a name that sounds suspicious.

That wouldn't be a life-wasting job at all aye. Maybe thats why they don't catch bots cos of their names?

Im not going to give a full explanation here but look up regex.

its a text searching system that goes beyond 1:1 string lookups and allows for pattern recognition.

For instance i could do a regex search for all names containing the letters riot, in that specific order with no alphabetical characters inbetween and instantly flag them as the riot keyword.

This would instantly disable any and all forms of workarounds including spaces, fullstops, underscores etc since the regex search would be ignoring those characters in the pattern recognition.

The output of the search would always be riot, so you could have "r.  .i.. o    t... blah" and the regex search would output "riot" into the variable which can then be read to flag the name.

In other words commonly used botting name practices could be coded in fairly quickly and automatically flagged.

I'm sure some of the hardcore 'coop vs ai' mains (I don't understand these people but whatever floats your boat I guess) would be down for that sort of thing if you did like 1rp for every 100 confirmed bot accounts banned.

You tell me, it's not like you can set up programs to find names like these and make lists.

I got rekt.

EDIT: not to mention "millions" how many NEW accounts do you think there are daily?
I'd say 75-80% of the money I've ever given riot was for boosts for my account and my smurfs. By allowing the botting industry to flourish Riot is giving away a major source of income.

Not really, people who buy botted accounts have disposable income and will likely buy skins etc. as well.

And riot gets to boast a higher player count for things like TV stations paying for hosting League events.

>
> And riot gets to boast a higher player count for things like TV stations paying for hosting League events.

That's what happens on those Chinese streaming services that host league games: 6 million viewers at one time!, when in reality its probably about 20-50k.

The latest naming code for ARAM bots is f{SOMETHING}. And there are others with nonsensical three syllable names also such as Dalnufun, Folmerdag.

What is concerning is that these bots have not been banned and they have over 100 WINS in ARAM. So they've played many more games than just those wins. I recently came across one that I had played over 6 months ago (Fhuydarpick) and they are still going despite multiple reports.

C'mon Riot Games its very easy to nuke obvious bots. Do you really want those level 1 players in ranked ruining more games after buying a $10 botted account on PA? There's 200 available for sale there, and some of those have summoner names written on the site. Spend an hour or two of work to kill 100 bots, or just do nothing ?

I've been playing a few years and only come across a few bots in my games but definitely had one last night. Wouldnt be so bad if the bots used decent AI but it was basically an intent feed fest and guaranteed loss for me (in flex placements... fml)

My pet hate at the moment is a couple bots on your team vs pre made high elo lvl 30's with no level 30s on your team.  Level 10 and up to level 26 was the highest. I have had no level 30's on my team for the last 4 matches. 
No fun when you see bots get smashed by gold/silver/bronze players who keep feeding off them or new players who have no idea about the game.
Yeah, rito have no clue. It's why I regret going to work in the gaming industry.  Gaming companies just don't have any idea what they are doing anymore and it shows so much in season 6 with rito!
Just look at the table talk with gbay99 and skara. They say one thing but then they change again, say another thing then say they screwed up and say another all together.
I love how they actually did stop them.
Yeah that's why yesterday well i was doing a run on my smurf i had 2,3,3,2,3,2 bots in each game, that's 50% of the players i had on my team were bots.
Yeah in one game, not every game.
What i just listed was **6** games.
sarcasm?
